name: MoSP Geo Tool
body:
### Mobile Security & Privacy Simulator Geo Tool
The Mobile Security & Privacy (MoSP) Simulation Geo Tool helps to modify and optimize spatial data from the [OpenStreetMap](http://www.openstreetmap.org/) project for the use with the Mobile Security & Privacy Simulator.

MoSP Geo Tool

* shows XML-based OSM maps with map tiles in background
* visualizes the different partitions of a map
* connects or removes partitions of the map graph based on user parameters 
  (otherwise simulated people could not be routed between road network partitions)
* implements basic street filters
* connects selected points of interest (poi) to the road network (basic direct connection as well as intelligent connection of poi inside a building via its entrance)
* calculates and applies line generalization to the map graph using the Douglas-Peucker algorithm to lower number of nodes based on user parameters

German detailed information can be found in the corresponding bachelor thesis. Simply ask for the pdf document.

### Support or Contact
The MoSP Geo Tool has been started as a bachelor thesis at the [Distributed Computing & Security Group](http://www.dcsec.uni-hannover.de/), Leibniz Universit√§t Hannover, Germany. The initial developer does not work on the code anymore. Feel free to contact the corresponding person (thesis advisor) @bhenne at our Group.
